gw.api.webservice.messagingTools

Class Acknowledgement

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.webservice.messagingTools.Acknowledgement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GWRemotable

    public final class Acknowledgement
extends java.lang.Object
implements GWRemotable
    Acknowledgement contains information to be returned to ClaimCenter about processing of a message by an external system. This class encapsulates the 3 types of acknowledgements: Acknowledgement, ErrorAcknowledgement, DuplicateAcknowledgement For field changes and custom events,

      • Acknowledgement

        public Acknowledgement(long messageID)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageID

        public long getMessageID()
        Get the ID of the message to which this acknowledgement refers. (Guidewire internal use)
        Returns:
        The message ID.

      • setMessageID

        public void setMessageID(long messageID)
        Get the ID of the message to which this acknowledgement refers. (Guidewire internal use)
        Parameters:
        messageID - The message ID.

      • setAckCode

        public void setAckCode(java.lang.String ackCode)
        Deprecated. Please use a custom message extension field and FieldChanges to set custom values on the message.
        Set an acknowledgement code that will be stored with the message. Any value may be supplied and will be stored, subject to the string length limit of the field. This method is provided for customer convenience, primarily to allow reporting on the counts of various types of acknowledgements received.
        Parameters:
        ackCode - A String code to store.

      • getAckCode

        public java.lang.String getAckCode()
        Returns the acknowledgement code to store with the message. (Guidewire internal use)
        Returns:
        The code.

      • setErrorDescription

        public void setErrorDescription(java.lang.String errorDescription)
        Used to set an optional description of the error for help in displaying information about the error. Note that Acknowledgement.setAckCode() can be used to set an error code value.
        Parameters:
        errorDescription - A string describing the error.

      • getErrorDescription

        public java.lang.String getErrorDescription()
        Retrieve the error description.
        Returns:
        A String describing the error.

      • isRetryable

        public boolean isRetryable()
        Tests if the error is retryable. A retryable error may be corrected by resending the original message.
        Returns:
        True if the message should be resent.

      • setRetryable

        public void setRetryable(boolean retryable)
        Sets whether the error is retryable. A retryable error may be corrected by resending the original message.
        Parameters:
        retryable - True if the error may be corrected by resending the original message at a later time.

      • isDuplicate

        public boolean isDuplicate()
        Tests if the error is a duplicate.
        Returns:
        True if the error is a duplicate.

      • setDuplicate

        public void setDuplicate(boolean duplicate)
        Sets whether the error is a duplicate.
        Parameters:
        duplicate - true if the error is a duplicate

      • isError

        public boolean isError()
        Tests if the acknowledgment is an error. The acknowledgement is an error if it is a duplicate or has an error description.
        Returns:
        true if the acknowledgement is an error acknowledgment, false otherwise.

      • setError

        public void setError(boolean error)
        Tests if the acknowledgment is an error. The acknowledgement is an error if it is a duplicate or has an error description.
        Parameters:
        error - true if the acknowledgement is an error acknowledgment, false otherwise.

      • addFieldChanges

        public void addFieldChanges(java.lang.String objectKey,
                            FieldValue[] fieldValues)
        Add a list of field updates to the Acknowledgement. Updates specified by fieldValues will be applied to the object identified by objectKey. objectKey value must match the key marker mapping established when the message was created.
        Parameters:
        objectKey - String key identifying an object to apply changes to
        fieldValues - Array of FieldValue entries, each specifying a field on the object identified by objectKey and a value to set.

      • getFieldChanges

        public FieldChanges[] getFieldChanges()
        Retrieve field changes. (Guidewire internal use)
        Returns:
        array of field changes.

      • getCustomEvents

        public CustomEvents[] getCustomEvents()
        Retrieve custom events. (Guidewire internal use)
        Returns:
        array of custom events

      • addCustomEvents

        public void addCustomEvents(java.lang.String objectKey,
                            java.lang.String[] events)
        Add to a list of custom events to fire when the Acknowledgement is committed. Events will be associated with the object identified by objectKey. objectKey value must match the key marker mapping established when the message was created.
        Parameters:
        objectKey - String key identifying an object to apply changes to
        events - Array of names of custom events

      • setCustomEvents

        public void setCustomEvents(CustomEvents[] customEvents)
        Set the custom events that will be fired for an object when this acknowledgement gets processed
        Parameters:
        customEvents - the events to fire

      • setFieldChanges

        public void setFieldChanges(FieldChanges[] fieldChanges)
        Set the field changes for the acknowledgement.
        Parameters:
        fieldChanges - the field changes
